parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description:
Foundry Project endpoint in the form
"https://{ai-services-account-name}.services.ai.azure.com/api/projects/{project-name}".
If you only have one Project in your Foundry Hub, or to target the default Project
in your Hub, use the form
"https://{ai-services-account-name}.services.ai.azure.com/api/projects/_project"

get.description: List all connections in the project, without populating connection credentials

parameters.description: List connections of this specific type

values.name: AzureBlobStorage
values.description: Azure Blob Storage, with specified container

values.name: AzureStorageAccount
values.description: Azure Blob Storage, with container not specified (used by Agents)

values.name: APIKey
values.description: Generic connection that uses API Key authentication

parameters.name: defaultConnection
parameters.description: List connections that are default connections

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Identifier for the last run from the previous pagination request.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of runs to retrieve.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sort order for runs by timestamp. Use `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for descending order. Defaults to `asc`.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description:
Evals can be ordered by creation time or last updated time. Use
`created_at` for creation time or `updated_at` for last updated time.

schema.description: The response data for a requested list of items.

first_id.description: The first ID represented in this list.

last_id.description: The last ID represented in this list.

has_more.description: A value indicating whether there are additional values available not captured in this list.

post.description:
Create the structure of an evaluation that can be used to test a model's performance.
An evaluation is a set of testing criteria and the config for a data source, which dictates the schema of the data used in the evaluation. After creating an evaluation, you can run it on different models and model parameters. We support several types of graders and datasources.
For more information, see the [Evals guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/evals).

parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

parameters.description: The ID of the evaluation to retrieve runs for.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Identifier for the last run from the previous pagination request.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of runs to retrieve.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sort order for runs by timestamp. Use `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for descending order. Defaults to `asc`.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter runs by status. One of `queued` | `in_progress` | `failed` | `completed` | `canceled`.

parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Identifier for the last run from the previous pagination request.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of runs to retrieve.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sort order for runs by timestamp. Use `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for descending order. Defaults to `asc`.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Filter output items by status. Use `failed` to filter by failed output
items or `pass` to filter by passed output items.

AssetCredentialResponse.description: Represents a reference to a blob for consumption

blobReference.description: Credential info to access the storage account.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Azure REST API guidelines - https://aka.ms/AzureRestApiGuidelines#handling-errors.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

connectionName.description: Name of connection to Azure AI Search

indexName.description: Name of index in Azure AI Search resource to attach

type.description: The type of credential used by the connection

data_source_config.description: The configuration for the data source used for the evaluation runs. Dictates the schema of the data used in the evaluation.

testing_criteria.description: A list of graders for all eval runs in this group. Graders can reference variables in the data source using double curly braces notation, like `{{item.variable_name}}`. To reference the model's output, use the `sample` namespace (ie, `{{sample.output_text}}`).

properties.description:
Set of immutable 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object for storing additional information.
    Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum length of 512 characters.

data_source.description: Details about the run's data source.

DatasetType.description: Enum to determine the type of data.

isReference.description: Indicates if the dataset holds a reference to the storage, or the dataset manages storage itself. If true, the underlying data will not be deleted when the dataset version is deleted

connectionName.description: The Azure Storage Account connection name. Required if startPendingUploadVersion was not called before creating the Dataset

id.description: Asset ID, a unique identifier for the asset

tags.description: Tag dictionary. Tags can be added, removed, and updated.

deleted.description: Whether the eval was successfully deleted.
Whether the eval was successfully deleted.

modelDeploymentName.description: Deployment name of embedding model. It can point to a model deployment either in the parent AIServices or a connection.

Eval.title: Eval
Eval.description:
An Eval object with a data source config and testing criteria.
An Eval represents a task to be done for your LLM integration.
Like:
- Improve the quality of my chatbot
- See how well my chatbot handles customer support
- Check if o4-mini is better at my usecase than gpt-4o

data_source_config.description: Configuration of data sources used in runs of the evaluation.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the eval was created.

modified_at.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the evaluation run was last modified.

created_by.description: the name of the person who created the run.

properties.description:
Set of immutable 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object for storing additional information.
    Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum length of 512 characters.

x-oaiMeta.name: The eval object

EvalRun.title: EvalRun
EvalRun.description: A schema representing an evaluation run.

object.description: The type of the object. Always "eval.run".

id.description: Unique identifier for the evaluation run.

eval_id.description: The identifier of the associated evaluation.

status.description: The status of the evaluation run.

model.description: The model that is evaluated, if applicable.

name.description: The name of the evaluation run.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the evaluation run was created.

report_url.description: The URL to the rendered evaluation run report on the UI dashboard.

result_counts.description: Counters summarizing the outcomes of the evaluation run.

per_model_usage.description: Usage statistics for each model during the evaluation run.

per_testing_criteria_results.description: Results per testing criteria applied during the evaluation run.

data_source.description: Information about the run's data source.

modified_at.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the evaluation run was last modified.

created_by.description: the name of the person who created the run.

properties.description:
Set of immutable 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object for storing additional information.
    Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum length of 512 characters.

EvalRunOutputItem.title: EvalRunOutputItem
EvalRunOutputItem.description: A schema representing an evaluation run output item.

object.description: The type of the object. Always "eval.run.output_item".

id.description: Unique identifier for the evaluation run output item.

run_id.description: The identifier of the evaluation run associated with this output item.

eval_id.description: The identifier of the evaluation group.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the evaluation run was created.

status.description: The status of the evaluation run.

datasource_item_id.description: The identifier for the data source item.

datasource_item.description: Details of the input data source item.

results.description: A list of grader results for this output item.

sample.description: A sample containing the input and output of the evaluation run.

x-oaiMeta.name: The eval run output item object

EvalRunOutputItemResult.title: EvalRunOutputItemResult
EvalRunOutputItemResult.description: A single grader result for an evaluation run output item.

score.description: The numeric score produced by the grader.

passed.description: Whether the grader considered the output a pass.

sample.description: Optional sample or intermediate data produced by the grader.

label.description: The label associated with the test criteria metric (e.g., "pass", "fail", "good", "bad").

threshold.description: The threshold used to determine pass/fail for this test criteria, if it is numerical.

reason.description: The reason for the test criteria metric.

properties.description: Additional details about the test criteria metric.

EvalRunOutputItemSampleInput.description: A message in the evaluation run.

tool_calls.description: Tool calls made within the message, if any.

EvalRunOutputItemSampleOutput.description: A message in the evaluation run.

tool_calls.description: Tool calls made within the message, if any.

OpenAI.Metadata.description:
Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard.
Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings
with a maximum length of 512 characters.
